_meta.purpose: Ensure fair compensation and protection for all contributors through evidence-based economic governance
_meta.description: Economic and labor vocabulary extending DAHAO Core terms.

@labor_capacity.definition: The capacity to provide value through work, effort, skill, or resource contribution to a collective endeavor.

confidence_levels.HIGH: Verifiable on-chain or signed proof across multiple metrics

@exploitation.definition: A prolonged state of unfair value extraction where compensation does not match contribution, causing economic harm or deprivation.
@exploitation.note: Operational thresholds vary by context; uncertainty triggers @protection_ratchet

@fair_compensation.definition: The economic state where a contributor receives value proportional to their contribution, enabling sustainable participation.
components: Token compensation (GLITCH tokens via streaming payments or block rewards)
Voice in governance proportional to delegated stake

graduated_response: 24-48 hours overdue: automated warning to responsible party
48-72 hours overdue: public flagging in governance dashboard
72+ hours overdue: 1% daily penalty interest accrues to contributor
exceptions: Force majeure (network outage, chain halt) with documented evidence

@fair_compensation.assessment: Measured through @exploitation indicators, @five_labor_rights compliance, contribution metrics, and timing compliance.

@value.definition: Measurable output or contribution that benefits the collective endeavor.
@value.measurement: Defined by domain-specific metrics and community consensus

@token.definition: Native token of the Glitch AppChain, used for value exchange, governance weight, and staking within the system.

properties.transferable: Can be exchanged between wallet addresses via x/bank MsgSend
properties.stakeable: Can be delegated to validators for governance weight via x/staking
properties.ibc_enabled: Can be transferred across IBC-connected chains
properties.non_dilutable: Per @protection_ratchet, earned tokens cannot be retroactively reduced

types: Contribution tokens (earned through work, distributed via x/distribution)

@inflation.definition: Dilution of token value through excessive issuance without corresponding value creation.
risk_indicators: Token supply growth exceeding value creation
@inflation.protection: Per @protection_ratchet, inflation cannot retroactively reduce earned value

@contribution_indicators.definition: Measurable markers indicating productive contribution to the system.

@five_labor_rights.definition: Five fundamental rights for all contributors in the system.

rights.name: freedom_from_wage_theft
rights.description: Fair and timely compensation for all work performed

rights.name: freedom_from_unsafe_conditions
rights.description: Healthy and safe work environment, physical or digital

rights.name: freedom_from_exploitation
rights.description: No forced labor, excessive hours, coercion, or value extraction without consent

rights.name: freedom_to_organize
rights.description: Right to collective bargaining, representation, and governance participation

rights.name: freedom_from_discrimination
rights.description: Equal treatment and opportunity regardless of background

@five_labor_rights.source: ILO Core Labor Standards and modern labor rights frameworks
@five_labor_rights.evolution_note: Rights may be extended but not reduced per @protection_asymmetry

@stakeholder_profile.definition: Comprehensive documentation of a stakeholder type's contribution evidence, compensation requirements, and protection status.

@practice.definition: An economic activity or policy that affects contributor welfare, subject to ethical assessment.

@economic_verdict.definition: Assessment of a practice's alignment with labor rights and fair compensation principles.

options.ETHICAL: Does not violate labor rights; acceptable practice
options.EXPLOITATIVE: Violates one or more labor rights; should be eliminated
options.COMPLEX: Mixed impacts; requires context and mitigation

@economic_verdict.note: Verdicts are operationalized via @rule_practice_evaluation. Use COMPLEX for mixed-impact cases with mitigation; reserve EXPLOITATIVE for elimination-presumptive cases.

@economic_impact.definition: Measurable effects of a practice on contributor welfare and compensation.
@economic_impact.evidence_required: Claims about economic impact require evidence per @evidence_based

@proof_of_useful_work.definition: Verifiable evidence that a contribution has been made, enabling fair reward allocation via Cosmos governance.

tier_A_on_chain.description: Cryptographically verifiable on Cosmos chain via transaction hash
tier_A_on_chain.verification: Query via RPC endpoint or block explorer

tier_A_signed.description: Digitally signed with wallet key and auditable
examples: Deliverable submissions (IPFS hash in tx memo)

tier_C.description: Self-reported with community attestation via governance vote

@proof_of_useful_work.reward_trigger: Valid proof triggers @reward_allocation via x/distribution or x/bank MsgSend

@economic_stability.definition: The principle that the economic system must maintain sufficient reserves and stability mechanisms to sustainably honor all contributor protections and compensation obligations.

reserve_requirement.minimum: 15% of circulating token supply held in treasury reserve
reserve_requirement.purpose: Absorb economic shocks without compromising contributor payments
reserve_requirement.priority_during_shortfall: Contributor compensation takes precedence over discretionary spending

stability_indicators: Treasury reserve ratio vs. outstanding obligations

constraints: Stability measures cannot reduce existing contributor protections per @protection_ratchet
Reserve requirements cannot delay verified contributor payments per @fair_compensation
@economic_stability.rationale: Sustainable systems require economic foundations. Contributor protections depend on system solvency. Per @proportionality, stability measures must balance system health against contributor welfare, with contributor welfare taking priority in direct conflicts.

@gradual_transition.definition: Policy changes should be phased over minimum 90 days with clear milestones. Abrupt shifts create chaos and unintended consequences.
@gradual_transition.rationale: Slow and steady allows adaptation; haste creates victims.

@balanced_stakeholders.definition: All parties (workers, platforms, validators, token holders) must have proportional representation in governance. No single group should dominate.
@balanced_stakeholders.rationale: Sustainable systems require buy-in from all participants.

@dispute_resolution.definition: A structured pre-proposal process for resolving stakeholder conflicts through mediation before escalation to formal governance.
@dispute_resolution.scope: Applies to stakeholder-to-stakeholder disputes (compensation, contribution attribution, resource allocation) that do not yet require formal governance proposals.

process.initiation: Any affected stakeholder may request mediation
process.documentation: Both parties must present evidence per @evidence_based
process.outcome: Non-binding recommendation; parties may accept or escalate to formal governance

power_balance_provisions: Mediators must consider information asymmetry between parties
Parties with greater resources must provide relevant documentation upon request
No barriers to participation for any stakeholder type
@dispute_resolution.relationship_to_governance: Complements @democratic_evolution; does not replace formal proposals or votes. Mediation outcomes inform but do not bind governance decisions.

@contribution_assessment.definition: A transparent, evidence-based process for evaluating stakeholder contributions to determine fair compensation, bridging proof of work verification with reward allocation.
components: Criteria transparency: Assessment standards must be published before application
Evidence responsibility: Systems/platforms maintain assessment records, not individual contributors
Proportional evaluation: Assessment rigor scales with contribution magnitude
Stakeholder input: Criteria development includes affected stakeholder representation
Appeal pathway: Contributors may challenge assessments through governance mechanisms
safeguards: Information asymmetries shall not disadvantage contributors
Each contributor's assessment matters individually per @individual_consideration
Uncertainty in assessment triggers @precautionary_default favoring contributor

@evidence_accessibility.definition: The principle that evidence requirements must account for parties' differential access to documentation, ensuring fair dispute resolution when information asymmetry exists.
asymmetry_indicators: Documentation requires credentials only one party possesses
Work records stored in proprietary systems
Historical data purged or inaccessible to contributor

remedies.documentation_escrow: Platforms must maintain accessible copies of contributor work records
remedies.burden_shift: Burden shifts to party controlling evidence when asymmetry is demonstrated
remedies.adverse_inference: Failure to produce requested documentation may be interpreted against withholding party

tiered_response.minor_asymmetry: Extended deadlines for contributor evidence gathering
tiered_response.moderate_asymmetry: Platform required to produce relevant records within 48 hours

safeguards: Asymmetry must be demonstrated, not assumed
Both parties retain right to present counter-evidence

@payment_verification.definition: The principle that contributors must have independent means to verify their compensation is accurate, complete, and timely through accessible records.

components.record_accessibility: Contributors can access payment history via chain queries or dashboard
components.calculation_transparency: Formulas determining compensation are published and auditable
components.discrepancy_reporting: Clear pathway to flag and resolve payment discrepancies

verification_methods.on_chain: Query glitch1... address transaction history via block explorer
verification_methods.export: Contributor can export payment history for independent audit

@worker_advocacy.definition: When evidence is genuinely ambiguous in compensation disputes after exhausting @evidence_accessibility remedies, interpretations should favor the contributor who provided labor.

scope.applies_to: Compensation disputes where evidence remains ambiguous after @evidence_accessibility processes complete
scope.does_not_apply: Disputes with clear evidence, non-compensation matters, bad-faith claims

triggers: No clear preponderance of evidence for either party
safeguards: Only applies after structured @dispute_resolution process attempted
Pattern of frivolous claims may trigger review per @proportionality
Does not override clear contrary evidence
@worker_advocacy.rationale: Labor creates the value being disputed. When all evidence-gathering mechanisms have been exhausted and ambiguity persists, the party who contributed labor should receive benefit of doubt. This complements @labor_primacy by providing a tiebreaker that honors contribution.

@expedited_payment_option.definition: An opt-in mechanism allowing contributors to receive verified compensation within 24 hours, with proportional tradeoffs.

components.eligibility: Contributors with verified contributions (Tier A or B)
components.request_method: Flag contribution as expedited-eligible at submission
tradeoffs: Streamlined verification (automated checks only, no manual review)

safeguards: Does not reduce standard 48-hour pathway rights
Subject to @gradual_transition pilot phase (30 days, 10% of contributors)
Fee waiver for documented financial hardship

@validator_commission_cap.definition: Maximum commission rate validators may charge delegators, protecting staker compensation from excessive extraction.

cap.rationale: Balances validator operational costs with delegator fair compensation per @contribution_axiom

grandfathering.hardship_exception: Documented operational costs via governance proposal
